review: I understand that this will change with time, but there are not many applications available presently.There is no question that this device out performs almost everything I have ever used for a media center device.Comparing it to my WDTV Live is like comparing the internet speeds we get now, to early 1990's speeds. It opens, downloads, and loads all applications at an outstanding rate. It scrolls, plays, fast forwards, and rewinds video without hesitation.The Roku 3 I owned holds up better in comparison, and far out strips it in application content. But even that cannot compete with the lightning fast reflexes of this device.The voice function is very handy, though I do not use it much as I am not like Gary Bussey with my taste for talking to inanimate objects.But all things considered, I cannot say that I find much use for it as of right now. Yes, I can watch Netflix, and Amazon video on demand content, but the wealth of media centered, and game centered, applications available on the Play store that I cannot access, decidedly deters me from using this great device for more than background noise when I'm trying to fall asleep. ( it has been relegated to my bedroom until its usefulness out-performs that of my HTPC ) So, I will say this. HURRY IT UP DEVELOPERS!
